comment: I was excited by this Prof at first. Got an A on the first test. Found her entertaining. Class became a snooze fest. All she does is read slides to you. Made C's on the following tests even after reading the chapters. The test questions can be really confusing and not found in book. Rarely offers extra credit even though she teases you with it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: One of the easiest classes I took. Show up and you will pass. Tests are easy and lectures are fun.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures

comment: Not a hard science teacher. Very available responsive and wants you to succeed. Class makes you want to really care about the enviroment.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She barely responds to emails and if you are the lucky one to receive an email back than it more than likely will take a while. She is very adamant about her class being tough even though it is a gen ed she even tells you this whole talk on the first day.  Also DO NOT skip class. again DO NOT skip class. she does not post her power points

I have never failed a class in college or high school but I managed to fail her class. She does not care about you, avoid her class at all costs. She is a horrible professor and doesn't realize science 1102 is a joke class and shouldn't be that serious... She doesn't respond to emails and clearly could care less if you fail. Just don't take her.

I hate science but this was actually pretty fun. She is young and relatable and you won't dread class. The main thing is study and go to class. If you do that I can't imagine thinking this class is that tough.
there are a lot of complaints on here but honestly the class wasn't all that hard.   alex lamle was helpful and easy to listen to.  not one of the easiest subjects but if you study this isn't bad.

One of the most inspirational professors I've had. Always took time to explain tough material and how it affects students' lives. Would chat after class to help you understand, or even answer your questions and arguments.

She may seem easy at first and the material doesn't seem like it will be hard at all. its just the format of her tests are hard and the questions are tricky which will make all your studying go to waste. She also doesn't drop any tests and theres only 4 tests . Lectures are boring and hard to stay awake in.

Her class started out fine... but as soon as I took the first test after studying extremely well with the notes from her power points AND the study guide that was not even close to what was on the test. Her testes are difficult and much more in depth than she seems to go in class.  I would not suggest taking her class.

I would NEVER take her again. She wasn't as clear as she could be with all the information given. I also was late to the final because of transportation issues and I know she gave me an F because of that. She clearly expressed and showed me that she wasn't having it. I would NOT suggest her.

Her class isn't easy but if you put effort into it u will be fine. She doesn't post her PPP online so I had to resort to taking pictures of her slides instead and she allows it. But she doesn't make it very hard to pass her class if u show up to class she might give u extra credit. Just do your work, but not showing up for class that's your fault.

Has her lectures on power points. She sometimes goes through them fast but have your phone out and snap pictures of them to be sure you don't miss anything. She is very slow at responding to emails, if she responds at all. And expect a week and a half to 2 weeks to get your test grades back. I wouldn't skip class, she usually lets you out early.

She is a very tough grader. She does not care about the students or their graders. I WOULD NEVER take her ever again, avoid her if you can. Got A's in all my other classes the Bio lab was my lowest grade.
